title: Thomas Gordon (rugby union)
text:
Thomas Gordon (born 30 January 1997) is a <a href="Scotland%20Club%20XV">Scotland Club XV</a> professional <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who plays for <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a> at the <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Flanker">Flanker</a> position.
Rugby Union career.
Amateur career.
Gordon plays for <a href="Currie%20RFC">Currie Chieftains</a>.
He secured a Stage 2 place in the <a href="Scottish%20Rugby%20Academy">Scottish Rugby Academy</a> in the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Scottish%20Rugby%20Academy%20season">2015–16 season</a>.
Professional career.
The flanker secured a <a href="Scottish%20Rugby%20Academy">Scottish Rugby Academy</a> Stage 3 place with <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh</a> for the <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20Scottish%20Rugby%20Academy%20season">2016–17 Scottish Rugby Academy season</a>.
On 9 July 2018 it was announced that Gordon had signed a professional deal with <a href="Glasgow%20Warriors">Glasgow Warriors</a>. This was a year long partnership contract which meant that Gordon could still play for Currie when not in use by the Warriors.
He made his first appearance for the Warriors in their 50 -17 demolition of <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">Harlequins</a> at <a href="North%20Inch">North Inch</a>, <a href="Perth%2C%20Scotland">Perth</a> on 18 August 2018.
Gordon made his competitive Glasgow Warriors debut in the <a href="Pro14">Pro14</a> match against <a href="Ospreys%20%28rugby%20union%29">Ospreys</a> at <a href="Scotstoun%20Stadium">Scotstoun Stadium</a> on 25 January 2019. The Warriors won the match 9-3.
International career.
New Zealand-born Gordon, 21, qualifies for Scotland through his grandparents and has been capped at <a href="Scotland%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland U20s</a>. He has also been capped for <a href="Scotland%20Club%20XV">Scotland Club XV</a>. Gordon received his first call up to the senior <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> squad on 15 January 2020 for the <a href="2020%20Six%20Nations%20Championship">2020 Six Nations Championship</a>.
